articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday there could be no permanent ceasefire in Gaza until Hamas was destroyed, casting doubt on a key part of a truce proposal that U.S. President Joe Biden said Israel itself had made.
articles.title: Netanyahu says no Gaza ceasefire until Hamas destroyed

articles.author: Gerry Doyle
articles.description: Chinese defence chief Dong Jun's speech comes a day after U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin told delegates the Indo-Pacific region remains a key focus for the United States.
articles.title: China's defence minister, Zelenskiy dominate Shangri-La Dialogue's last day

articles.author: Joe Bavier, Wendell Roelf
articles.description: Looking out of his window at Cape Town's False Bay, Nick Searra acknowledges that things do work better in South Africa's second biggest city, a stronghold of the opposition Democratic Alliance (DA).
articles.title: South Africa's potential kingmakers struggle with white image

articles.author: Gerry Doyle
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodomyr Zelenskiy met heads of state and legislators in Singapore late on Saturday and early on Sunday, seeking security assistance and support for a peace summit after arriving for a surprise visit to the Shangri-La Dialogue.
articles.title: Zelenskiy meets heads of state in Singapore, seeks support for security summit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The landing elevates China's space-power status in a global rush to the moon, where countries are hoping to exploit lunar minerals to sustain long-term astronaut missions and moon bases.
articles.title: China makes historic landing on far side of the moon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea sent some 600 balloons carrying trash into South Korea overnight, Seoul said on Sunday, in Pyongyang's latest move to rile its rival neighbour.
articles.title: North Korea sends 600 more trash balloons over border, South says

articles.author: Krishna N. Das, Rishika Sadam, Chris Thomas
articles.description: The coalition could win 55 to 64 seats in five southern states, nearly double what it won in 2019.
articles.title: Modi's alliance set to break India's southern ceiling

articles.author: Mike Spector
articles.description: Boeing executives are unlikely to be criminally charged over fatal crashes in 2018 and 2019 that killed 346 people as the statute of limitations has likely passed, U.S. Justice Department officials told victims' family members in a meeting.
articles.title: Boeing executives unlikely to be charged over 737 MAX crashes, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former world chess champion Garry Kasparov, who fled Russia a decade ago for fear of persecution, may face a criminal case in Moscow for violating the Kremlin's "foreign agent" law, TASS news agency reported on Sunday.
articles.title: Russia threatens former chess champion Kasparov with criminal charges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China and the United Arab Emirates have emphasised a readiness to exchange experiences on defence and security, with a view to upgrading capacities of military personnel and security institutions in both countries, China's foreign ministry said on Sunday.
articles.title: China, UAE ready to trade defence and security experiences
